thread.title: Report: Atlanta Braves acquire Brandon Phillips
thread.title_full: Report: Atlanta Braves acquire Brandon Phillips

title: Report: Atlanta Braves acquire Brandon Phillips
text:
Report: Atlanta Braves acquire Brandon Phillips The Atlanta Braves are on the verge of completing a trade for second baseman Brandon Phillips. Slot to 247Sports Links 
Veteran second baseman Brandon Phillips is reportedly moving back to Georgia. 
Phillips, who attended Redan High School in Stone Mountain, Ga., will be traded from the Cincinnati Reds to the Atlanta Braves on Sunday, per Fox Sports' Ken Rosenthal. 
Source: Phillips trade from #Reds to #Braves expected to be done tomorrow. CIN will pay most of Phillips’ $14M salary in 2017, save some $$. — Ken Rosenthal (@Ken_Rosenthal) February 12, 2017 
Source adds: #Reds ’ return will be minimal. Motivation for CIN is to clear infield logjam. — Ken Rosenthal (@Ken_Rosenthal) February 12, 2017 
Phillips is entering his 16th MLB season, the last 11 have been with Cincinnati. The infielder hit .291 with 11 home runs, 64 RBIs and a .320 on-base percentage in 2016. Phillips has been an All-Star three times. His most recent appearance was in 2013, and he has also won four Gold Gloves. 
Atlanta needed to add an infielder after Sean Rodriguez was involved in a car accident in January . It is unclear when Rodriguez will return. With Phillips in the fold, ESPN's Buster Olney projects the Braves' starting lineup to look like this: 
CF Ender Inciarte
